Intrathecal.Definition: Inside the spinal canal (the canal in successive vertebrae through which the spinal cord passes-Wordnet definition) . For example, intrathecal immunoglobulin production means production of this substance in the spinal cord;  intrathecal injection is an injection into the the spinal canal (intrathecal space surrounding the spinal cord), as in a spinal anaesthesia or in chemotherapy or pain management applications.
